column5: First trip to Rainy what is the best fishy walleye or smallies. Which has the strongest population on the lake.

BobberI was there this past November (early), and we caught a ton of smallies thanks to my buddy who guided me all over his hot-spots. Over 40 smallies for the two of us in 2 short fishing days. So, theyare there in large numbers. As for walleye, we never hooked up with one, but that doesn't mean they're not there. My pals Aqua-View showed walleye stacked up on some of the same areas as we were catching smallies...they just chose not to bite.I'm probably not the best one to spew forth information on the populations, but that's my experience anyway. good lucktom
I've fishing Rainy, both CA & US sides for 20 years I belive that you will have equal sucess no matter which species you target. TGG

hi bobber rainy lake is loaded with smallies walleye northerns and crapi. the right guide will put you on all the fish you [email protected] [email protected] [email protected] [email protected] these guys are great and will show you lots of fish. i got a three bedroom private cottage to rent if you need a place to stay. there are also several nice resorts to chose from. good luck on your trip you will have a great time.

I have fished Rainy for many years. For smallmouth, the north arm of the lake cannot be beat. For walleyes you should fish Red Gut or the south arm. We always stay at Camp Narrows Lodge on the north arm. Their specialty is catch and release smallmouth bass. www.campnarrows.ca , Good fishing and remember throw the big ones back.

If you really want to catch fish, try campfire island lodge on the canadian side. No other lodge has better guides take my word for it, all the ones in the above reply dont spend nearly as much time on the water. 40 fish in two days, try 50 in one afternoon. Dean, Gordie, and Jason know thier fish! Go to Campfire you'll be glad you went.www.campfireisland.com
